StochasticDFO.design_points.low_dim_vr module

low_dim_vr(pt, dim)

Returns the appropriate low dimensional vector from the high dimensional vector so that the low dimensional vector can be added to the inner design point. See Lemma 3.22 for details.

Parameters:

  • pt (numpy array) – The high dimensional vector in p-dimensional space.

  • dim (int) – The dimension of the space where the low dimensional vector lives

Returns:

out – The low dimensional vector, y, in l-dimensional space such that (y y^Q) is in a point in p-dimensional space.

Return type:

numpy array

StochasticDFO.design_points.projection module

proj(z, A)

Computes the orthogonal projection of z on the null space of A

Parameters:

  • z (1-D numpy array) – Point z

  • A (2-D numpy array) – Matrix A

Returns:

out – The Euclidean norm of the orthogonal projection of z on the null space of A

Return type:

float

StochasticDFO.design_points.q_vector module

construct_q_vector(vector)

Constructs the q-vector of a vector as defined in eqn. (46) in the tech report

Parameters:

vector (numpy array) – The point whose q-vector needs to be constructed.

Returns:

out – The q-vector of a vector as defined in eqn. (46) in the tech report
